properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 6 at 2:36AM PST until January 6 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW TODAY AND TONIGHT FOR THE CASCADES...
NORTHEAST WASHINGTON...BLUE MOUNTAINS...AND THE IDAHO
PANHANDLE...

.A storm system will arrive this morning with snow expanding into
many areas of Eastern Washington and North Idaho. Moderate to
heavy snow accumulations are expected and will likely impact
morning travel across the low elevations. Snow will transition to
rain for the Palouse and Spokane - Coeur D Alene Areas by this
afternoon.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3
inches.

* WHERE...Republic, Inchelium, Wauconda, Chesaw Road, Highway 20
Wauconda Summit, Boulder Creek Road, and Sherman Pass.

* WHEN...From 6 AM to 4 PM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of black ice will be possible
before snow develops. Snow on top of black ice may lead to
very slick conditions for the Monday morning commute,
especially along untreated roadways. Valley snow is expected
to change to rain late Monday afternoon or Monday night.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON
